poem:
**New Year Wire**

past midnight  
in the midwest—  
the west still waiting

Sydney's sky  
shattered into flowers  
over parks, lounge rooms,  
foreshores

police with long arms  
stand among paper cups  
after Bondi  
fifteen gone

across the sea  
a speech answered:  
lies, malice

the year turns  
like a page  
still damp with ink.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "New Year’s Eve celebrations around the world – as it happened 6.43am GMT We are going to wrap up our coverage of New Year’s Eve celebrations around the world now. Many thanks for following along. Wishing you a safe and happy 2026. 6.40am GMT Here are some more images of celebrations: 6.35am GMT It is now past midnight in the midwest of the US, leaving the west coast, Alaska and Hawaii still waiting for 2026. Updated at 6.36am GMT 6.14am GMT China is responding the Taiwan president’s New Year’s speech from earlier, claiming it is “full of lies”. Lai Ching-te had vowed to defend the island’s sovereignty after large-scale military drills by Beijing, state media reported. Lai Ching-te’s New Year address was “filled with lies and nonsense, hostility and malice”, said Taiwan Affairs Office spokesman Chen Binhua, adding that Lai had “incited cross-strait confrontation”, Beijing’s Xinhua news agency said. You can read more about the row here: Related: Xi Jinping vows to reunify China and Taiwan in New Year’s Eve speech 6.12am GMT In Australia, police have praised the respectful behaviour of millions of New Year revellers, marred only by a handful of incidents. After the 14 December terror attack at Bondi Beach that killed 15 people, there was a highly visible police presence in all capital cities, with many officers carrying long-arm weapons. Millions of Australians crammed foreshores and parks, backyards and lounge rooms, to ring in the new year with spectacular firework displays. As the clean-up got underway". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
